titleStmt.title: Tarltons iests Drawne into these three parts. 1 His court-wittie iests 2 His sound cittie iests. 3 His country prettie iests. Full of delight, wit, and honest myrth.
titleStmt.author: Tarlton, Richard, d. 1588, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by Thomas Snodham] for Iohn Budge, and are to be sold at his shop, at the great South doore of Paules,

notesStmt.note: "More or less fictitious anecdotes, many of them far older than Tarlton, who probably was in no way responsible for the work"--Folger Shakespeare Library catalogue.
In this edition, C2r line 5 from bottom has: Globe on the Bancke side.
Identified as STC 23684b on UMI microfilm reel 671..
Imperfect; all after D4 lacking; title page torn; some print show-through.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.

place.placeName: his shop, at the great South doore of Paules
